Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= process by which certain information becomes publicly available
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
= human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

Node.gloss: to advance upon (an area or people)|to make a raid
Node.definition: = action by which a group of armed people makes a sudden move in order to attack the people living there and steal their possessions

= a group of armed humans equipped for fighting on land, whose main purpose it is to execute swift attacks and loot and plunder as much as they can; sometimes also used to denote a unit of a more regular army
= referent to the location outside of an object
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

Node.gloss: to surround > to be a constant witness
Node.definition: literally: to surround; hence: = state in which humans remain constantly associated with and held responsible for past deeds
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which humans say things that not true in order to deceive or mislead others
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry
= state in which an object such as an oven contains fire
= person who made it his/her profession to bake food

Node.gloss: to rouse|to stir up|to raise|to stoke
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes an event to start taking place, ◄ as if it had been dormant or inactive for a certain time
= causative action by which humans mix flour with water and work it into dough ► in order to bake bread or cakes
= flour combined with water, milk, and other ingredients into a mass, ► for baking into bread or cake
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= process by which food becomes sour ◄ due to the addition of sourdough or leaven during the production process

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to lose their physical strength
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state of excitement of the body; ◄ caused by drinking intoxicating drinks; ► which may cause someone to lose restraint and behave in a way which differs from one's normal behavior

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

literally: to drag out (one's) hand with mockers; hence, possibly: = action by which someone associates with mockers, ◄ described with the image of someone stretching out one's hand to someone else asking that person to join in

literally: to drag out (one's) hand (with someone); hence, possibly: = action by which humans associate with other humans, ◄ described with the image of someone stretching out one's hand to someone else asking that person to join in
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
participle: someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: ambush; hence: = an effort to gain control over someone else in order to harm that person ◄ as if setting an ambush
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive
= person who made it his/her profession to bake food
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to burn; hence: = process by which events such as evil and anger happen with intensity and with consequences, as if it were fire

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
literally: to be hot (of one's לֵב (לֵב) heart); hence: = state in which humans experience extreme anger
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which people mix with other groups of people and adapt their ways of thinking and practices
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative action by which humans or deities turn an object upside down
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which two sets of objects are mixed through each other, ◄ and it appears as if one set was sprinkled over the other
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action by which humans provide evidence in court
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe

= a bird with a blue gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

Node.gloss: to be simple|to be naive|to be gullible|to be silly
Node.definition: = state in which humans are easily influenced by other people, ideas or their own passions ◄ because of their lack of wisdom and experience

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.gloss: to lower|to let down|to take down|to bring down|to take off (ornaments)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to move from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
= action by which humans refuse to be under someone else's rightful authority ◄ as someone who strays away from the place where he belongs
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee
= seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness

Node.gloss: to cut oneself|to gash oneself|to lacerate oneself|to band together|to troop together
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer|= action by which several people form a group in order to pursue a common goal together|read גדד (גדד)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to strengthen (someone's) arms; hence: = causative action by which deities cause nations to be powerful

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to give strength, to fortify|to repair|to let prevail
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause humans and objects to be strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

Node.gloss: to turn (to someone)|to return|to come back
Node.definition: literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support|literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
literally: a slack bow; hence: = a bow that has lost its spring and is therefore no longer useful
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
only used in poetry; = action by which humans express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
